fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently the [Update your profile and visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html#Updateyourprofileandvisibilitysettings-Formanagedaccounts] doesn't contain any information regarding the limitations of what an org. admin can edit on a user's profile

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Explicitly state in the documentation that profile visibility controls remain in the hands of an end-user even if the account is a managed account
 * State that the visibility settings cannot be administratively controlled
 * Explicitly define what a managed account is and what org. admins can't do(e.g. update profile visibility settings). [Managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html]

h3. Why this is important
 * We have received some feedback which points to misalignment on what our definition of a managed account is and what it encompasses

h3. Workaround
 * No known workaround
fields.summary: Update documentation: "Update your profile and visibility settings"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users define a custom header image in the "Profile" section, the image is being cropped

h3. Environment

Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access your Jira and click on the user's avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and click *Profile*
# Hover the mouse cursor over the top part of the screen and click *Update your header image* and click *Upload an image*
# Select an image which contains details on the left side

h3. Expected Results

The image is displayed completely

h3. Actual Results

The image appears cropped

h3. Notes

Possible solutions for it:

(1) change the CSS as follows:
{code}
img.fyBPkh
{ width: auto; }
{code}

(2) enable the ability to set a background color to the image header area such as:
{code}
div.bxbVvH
{ background-color: #005bbb; }
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom header image on Profile is being cropped

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an add on is deleted, the add on user should also be deleted. The deleted add on user still appear in the Cloud instance (mention, jira/people, user management)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install any add-on. A new system user will be added with the name addon_atlassian*
 # Un-installing the addon will not remove the addon user created in the step 1.
 # Go to <instance>/jira/people and search for the deleted add on user
 # Click on ... > manage access to see the user in the user management.

h3. Expected Results
Addon user should be deleted automatically or hidden completely so that they will not show-up in the drop down list when try to at mention a user.

h3. Actual Results
* Addon users are not deleted automatically when the addon is un-installed.
* Addon users are showing up in the drop down list whenever at mention any user.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Add on user for deleted add on still remain active in the user management

fields.description:
If recent migration performed from server to cloud and the groups are not approved and then the administrator tries to invite user it shows "We couldn't sent your invitation."

The error handling needs to correct so the administrator will approve the groups and able to invite new users.
fields.summary: Unable to invite user if the groups are not approved after server migration

fields.description:
Many organisations require identifying and managing elevated access to applications and services in a central location. Today, we cannot even identify the organisation administrators via the REST API, so we cannot automatically audit who has elevated access. This is a growing requirement of security and compliance.

The site-admins is already a special group that grants a site's highest level of access; a separate group like org-admins make sense.

A panel like the Product Admin panel for Site & Org admin, where users could add or remove groups to manage access, would be ideal.

Easier to implement (and an additional but separate suggestion) would be:
Add a flag on data objects on the "Get users in an organization" endpoint to identify organization administrators
fields.summary: REST API to pull Atlassian Organisation Adminis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not possible to see Product access for trusted users

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Cog icon* > User management
 # From the user list, for a Trusted user...
 # Click on *…* > *Show product access* for the desired trusted user

h3. Expected Results

It will show products that the user has access.

!Screenshot 2019-09-27_14-17-13-937.png|width=358,height=324!
h3. Actual Result

It shows “Product access failed to load. Please try again later.”

!Screenshot 2019-09-27_14-17-31-480.png|width=453,height=177!

 
h3. Workaround

Click on the user’s profile to check what products they have access to.
fields.summary: Not possible to see Product access for trusted users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users can be removed from the SCIM synced groups using the Atlassian admin UI if the SCIM groups are added to the *Product Access* configuration. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.  Add an externally synced group to Jira/Confluence product access ( admin.atlassian.com/s/<siteID>/apps )
2.  Go to a user in this group ( in the admin hub admin.atlassian.com/s/<siteID>/users ), that does have the default product access group for Jira/Confluence
3. Use the product access toggle to remove the Jira/Confluence access
4. The user is now removed from their externally managed group

h3. Expected Results

The operation is blocked because the user is added to a SCIM group which grants *Product Access* to the application.

h3. Actual Results

The operation is successful and the user is removed from the SCIM group, it'll only be possible to add the user to the group again if you remove him from the group on the IdP and add him back there, hence initiating a new sync that will re-add the user to the group on Atlassian's end.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users can be removed from the SCIM groups  if the SCIM groups are added to the Product Access configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently organization administrators(org admins) don't have any control over a managed user's privacy settings:
 !Screenshot 2019-09-26 at 11.13.29.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow org admins to control the user's privacy setting
 * Allow org admins to set default privacy settings for the claimed domain
 * Restrict privacy settings to specific sites - ID-7046

h3. Why this is important
 * Some org admins may want full control of their managed users' account privacy settings - there might be company policies regarding what can/can't be displayed
 * Specific departments/groups may want to have different(enforced) privacy settings

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds - a workaround will be added if a suitable workaround is found
fields.summary: Allow organization administrators(org admins) to have full control over user profile privacy settings

fields.description:
With the goal to be able to manage active/inactive accounts in Jira/Confluence Cloud and to have more control of user creation on the instances, some customers would like to have the ability to use an API to retrieve create date for users.

Currently, the only workaround is to use the following documentation to generate a CSV with the users' information:

- [Export users from a site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-users-from-a-site-833925313.html]
fields.summary: API to retrieve create date for users in Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
||Update - October 14, 2019||
|Hi everyone,
Apologies for the late update and thank you for the feedback. We are aware that the current invite experience needs to be improved. We are planning to implement some changes, including notifications, in the near-term. We will update this ticket as soon as we do so.
Best regards,
Jenny Chu
Product Manager, Teams|
h3. Problem

When a user is invited to a *Team*(under section- *People*), the user does not get notified about the invitation.
h3. Solution

Trigger an email notification for invitation to teams.
h3. Workaround

The invited users can search for the team name in the teams UI and there they can accept the invite.
fields.summary: Get a notification when a user is invited to a team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a product subscription is deleted, for example, Jira Core, this may break the Product Access page, it will display an error saying "No application access config found". Not allowing administrators to configure product and administrative access on the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is intermittent, so it won't reproduce easily, the steps below are the exact steps taken by Atlassian support to reproduce the problem on a fresh Cloud site.
 # Start a site with Jira Software
 # Start a trial on Jira Core
 # Delete the Jira Core subscription
 # Try to delete Jira Software, you will be prompted to cancel the whole subscription
 # Reactivate the Jira Core subscription
 # Delete the Jira Software subscription

h3. Expected Results

No more product access configuration for Jira Software is returned on Product Access or user profile access switcher toggle.
h3. Actual Results

The product access page breaks, looking at the HTTP requests, it still returns product access configuration for Jira Software, the user profile will also keep showing the product access switcher toggle for Jira Software.

h3. Notes

The issue may reproduce itself under similar circumstances of subscription management but not the same order of steps described on this bug report.
h3. Workaround

Reactivate the missing product and delete it again. If this does not work, contact our [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/] mentioning this bug report.
fields.summary: Deleting a Cloud product subscription may break the Product Access page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently it is possible to create an Atlassian account(licensed account) + portal-only account(customer account) using the same email address. Differences between the 2 account types: [Manage Jira Service Desk customer accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html#ManageJiraServiceDeskcustomeraccounts-Whichaccountisbestformycustomers?]
 * When both accounts exist using the same email address, the portal-only account which usually has all the Jira Service Desk requests associated with that account is no longer accessible, i.e. end users don't have access to their tickets
 * The site-admin will need to [migrate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html] the customer account to an Atlassian account
 * There aren't any validators or warnings to let site-admins know that this is happening and a migration(merge) to Atlassian account or removal of the licensed account is required

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a validator and give the site-admin the choice of migrating immediately or to cancel the operation - explain the implications of not migrating
 * Add a lozenge to let admins know that there is a portal-only account using the same email address and advise what the implications are if the account is left the way it is

h3. Why this is important
 * Customers may not be able to access Jira Service Desk tickets

h3. Workaround
 * Follow these instructions to migrate(merge) the 2 accounts: [Manage Jira Service Desk customer accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html#ManageJiraServiceDeskcustomeraccounts-HowcanIgivelicensestocustomersIwanttocollaboratewithintrueorConfluence?]
fields.summary: Creating a portal-only account and a licensed account(Atlassian account) using the same email address is allowed without notice/warning/advice

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an existing user with no site access (deactivated) attempts to access a product in the site, *Last seen on* gets updated in the user profile in the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deactivate user (unchecked "Has access on site")
# Login as deactivated user and attempt to access site

h3. Expected Results
"Last seen on" date remains the same as the deactivated user is unable to access the site

h3. Actual Results
User is unable to access the site, but "Last seen on" date gets updated

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Last seen on" timestamp is updated when an existing-deactivated user attempts to access the product

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

It can be confusing to see who has been added to a group membership when we want to select a huge number of users into a group. Furthermore, you will need to know and enter the name of the exact users who have not been added as a member and the list only goes up to 20 users. 
 !Screenshot 2019-09-18 at 2.47.39 PM.png|width=276,height=342!
h3. Suggestion

Removes members that already added to the group from the "Add members to group" panel and only displays those that have not been added to the group.

It would be helpful to increase the limit from the static 20
fields.summary: Adding Group membership displays existing members

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently is not clear for the site admins which is the method their users' login with [SAML Integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/g-suite-integration-938859740.html], [G Suite Integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/g-suite-integration-938859740.html] or with the Atlassian Account credentials.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it possible for site-admins to see what was the users' last authentication method: i.e. SAML, Social Login (_Log in with Google_) or Atlassian Account credentials.
fields.summary: Display to site-admins users' last authentication method

fields.description:
*Problem*
* It's not possible to restric users' access to tickets by time.

*Suggestion*
* Allow site-admin to restrict users' access to the history of the projects. For example: users should not be able to access a ticket after 6 months.
fields.summary: Allow site-admin to restrict users' access to the history of the projects.

fields.description:
h4.Summary

Currently, the password changes flow doesn't validate the password change for a user when they decided to change their password from id.atlassian.com. The success message only is shown for a while and could be easily missed out if the user wasn't paying attention on the screen.

Here's the improvement that we need to provide for the customer:
* Additional password validation field to prevent *Human Error* (Typo)
* Probably would be best to have a sticky banner on the screen to show the success message.
* Improve the UI flow. Direct user to a success page.
fields.summary: Improve the UI flow for password changes process

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When grating org admin permission from an organization reverting user to *Basic*role from the user management. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create an organization and added the site to the org
# Grant user org admin permission from the admin console.
# Noticed that the UI glitch and revert the user back to *Basic* role.

h3. *Expected Results*

User should be on *site-administrator* role from user management.

h3. *Actual Results*

User is reverting back to *Basic* role even they are in *site-admin* group.


h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment. But in this case, the site admin permission doesn't impact the functionality of the user as an org admin. But it would be more to a UI bug.
fields.summary: When granting admins permission to user, user management keeps reverting the user back to Basic role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After doing a site import from either Cloud or Server, the site-admin must approve the imported groups access into the applications. The message says "*You need to review groups imported from server*" regardless of if the import was done from Cloud or Server which is misleading.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Execute a site-import to Cloud
 # At the product access page, click on *Review imported groups*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.24.26.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * The message should be specific (e.g. *You need to review groups imported from Cloud,* or *You need to review groups imported from server*)

h3. Actual Results
 * *You need to review groups imported from server*

h3. Workaround

No available workaround
fields.summary: Misleading message on product access page after site import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Atlassian Account, a generated (but not used) password reset link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a password reset link by using the _Can't log in_ option
 # Change the email address of the Atlassian Account

h3. Expected Results
Once the email address is changed, the password reset link (that was sent to the previous email address) becomes invalidated

h3. Actual Results
The password reset link is not invalidated, it's still functional.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: password reset link does not expire after email address change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The GMT offset shown in the "Personal settings" page does not account for "summer" or "daylight savings" time:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-13 at 10.36.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Personal profile settings: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
 # Try to change the timezone settings by selecting the city that you'd like to set the timezone setting to

h3. Expected Results
The GMT offset is correct given the time of year

h3. Actual Results
The GMT offset is usually behind by 1 hour as the field values do not account for "summer" or "daylight savings" time.

h3. Notes
* Important to note that the timezone is set correctly and the timestamps in Jira are displaying the correct local time.  It's only the GMT offset values in the settings page that is not correct
* Loosely related to [JRACLOUD-70089|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70089]

h3. Workaround
*  No known workarounds to get the GMT offset information to display correctly
* The timezone settings can still be selected by city
fields.summary: Personal settings: GMT offsets for Americas and European timezone do not account for "summer" or "daylight" timezones

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the browser language to anything other than English
# Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email, enter a new mail address and click "Save changes" three times(you cam revert to the original setting before confirming the new mail address)

h3. Expected Results
The translation corresponding to the following error message is shown.
{quote}
*Daily limit reached*
We limit email changes to help keep your account safe. You can try again in 24 hours.
{quote}
 !スクリーンショット 2019-08-28 14.20.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The following error message is shown.
{quote}
*Oops, something went wrong*
We couldn't save your email change. Please try again.
{quote}
 !スクリーンショット 2019-08-28 14.22.55.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Checking the response in the browser console, it seems the localized error message is returned. However it is not reflected to the message.
 !スクリーンショット 2019-08-28 14.25.11.png|thumbnail! 
* This affects the customer because non-English users aren't able to know what is happening

h3. Workaround
Check the response using the browser console, or change your browser setting to English
fields.summary: The error message when reaching the limit of mail address change isn't shown when browser language setting is a non-English

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently it's not possible to gather information about when a is being granted with specific product access. This information could be retrieved through Jira audit logs, which is not easy to get this information for multiple users.

h3. Why this is important?
Some organizations take actions on _inactive_ users by comparing user's last seen date with user's product access date. This provides the clarification about _inactive_ users who did not access the site for specific period of time since they were granted with product access.

h3. Suggested resolution
Include *product access granted date* for each user either in site administration (UI) or in user export CSV file.
fields.summary: Timestamp for product access granted to users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When login using Google menu (at the top right corner), the Atlassian Account Full name would be updated to Google's Full name.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Non GSuite


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign in to https://id.atlassian.com with Google using the Google menu

 [^googlelogin.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
No change in the Atlassian Account details

h3. Actual Results
Full name is changed to Google's Full name

h3. Workaround
If you'd like to use google to login, you can use the Login with Google button

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Signing with Google causing the Full Name to change to Google's full name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If Windows 10 OS is set to non-English language, and browser is also set to non-English language, cannot log in to account that is created through https://bitbucket.org, but there is no issue if account is created through https://id.atlassian.com directly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set Windows 10 languge to non-English language
# Set browser's language to non-English language
# Register new account through https://bitbucket.org
# Verify account and log out
# Try login again and nothing happens
# This error shown in console:
{code}
helpers.js:101 Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'btoa' on 'Window': The string to be encoded contains characters outside of the Latin1 range.
at https://aid-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/atlassian-id/front-end/5.0.13/static/js/app.7862ab5f.chunk.js:1:169848
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Can login to account.

h3. Actual Results

After click "Log in", nothing happens.

h3.Workaround

Change browser language to English to be able to login again, and user would be able to login afterwards even when the language is changed back to non-English.
fields.summary: Cannot login to Bitbucket account when Windows and browser language not in English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The scroll-bars on the page to invite users are not working. It looks like they are actually scrolling the page in background (the list of users in the instance). This is causing troubles to people using a low resolution. Scrolling with the mouse wheel works fine.

A short screen recording showing the issue is attached:
 [^invite-scrollbars.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In your instance, go t *Administration > Users*  (https://admin.atlassian.com/s/XXXXXXXXXXX/users)
 # Click on the *Invite Users* button
 # Resize the browser window in a way that the page does not fit all in the window (e.g. the *Invite Users* button is outside the page)
 # Try to use the scrollbar to get to the bottom of the page

h3. Expected Results
You can scroll to the bottom of the page and click on the *Invite Users* button

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, the page does not scroll. See:  [^invite-scrollbars.mp4] 
Actually, it looks like the scroll-bars are the ones for the Users page that is in background

h3. Workaround
You can use the mouse wheel to scroll or click in the middle of the page and use the arrow keys.
Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scroll bars not working on the "invite users" page

fields.description:
h3. *Suggestion*
Allow "suggest changes" confirmation link to perform the actual change for the user
 !Screenshot 2019-08-22 at 9.04.55 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow "suggest changes" confirmation link to perform the actual change for the user

fields.description:
*Problem*
It's not possible to authenticate to Atlassian products if 3rd-party cookies are not enable.

*Suggestion*
* Allow users to authenticate in a way that 3rd-party cookies are not necessary.
fields.summary: Improve authentication service to don't use 3rd-party cookies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The landing page is unable to identify the user Jira application access. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Product access, remove *site-admins* group from product access and administration access.
# For an existing user, remove all the groups assigned and add the user only to the site-admins group.
# Now try to login to the site with the above user account.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to see the administration panel of the site where the user could manage users/site

h3. Actual Results
# In the user details, it shows that the user doesn't have access to any application (attached screenshot)

# When the user logs in to the application, the users will be redirected to JSD portal or id.atlassian.com which doesn't have an option to browse the administrator page (admin.atlassian.com)


h3. Notes
The intention is to give users site admins permissions so that they could administer the site as a whole and shouldn't have access to any of the products (shouldn't consume license). Related to the bug JRACLOUD-71024 which is closed now

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to manually access https://<site-name>/admin/ OR login to the application and access admin.atassian.com
fields.summary: Landing page is unable to identify the user without application access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Invisible special characters may break the log in for Atlassian accounts, these characters can be inserted by accident in any of the profile details fields if copying the value from another system.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit one of the Atlassian account fields, such as full name.
 # Add a special character to it. (Use external systems to generate them for testing)
 # Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

The special characters should be either removed or an alert should be sent to the user saying the name format contains them.
h3. Actual Results

The changes are saved and once the user logs out, they will not be able to log in back again, receiving this error:
{quote}*Oops, there was an error logging you in.*
 Please contact your administrator to check single sign-on configuration.
{quote}
URL will contain this error message:
{code:java}
error=access_denied&error_description=Invalid response code from the auth0-sandbox: HTTP 400. Invalid or unexpected token{code}
h3. Notes

This may happen by accident if you copy the text from another system that uses special characters to display text, such as a communicator or text editor.
h3. Workaround

There is none at the moment, contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] to validate the cause and clear the special characters from your profile.
fields.summary: Invisible special characters may break the log in for Atlassian accounts
Provide more meaningful error message when a site-admin tries to impersonate another site-admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User added to team does not see the team they are invited/added to
h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team and invite a user
# Login as the invited user and access the People directory

h3. Expected Results
The user may find the team created in #1
h3. Actual Results
The team cannot be found
 
h3. Workaround
Find the user that invited you to the team, click on the team appearing under the user and you should be able to find the team
fields.summary: User invited to team does not see invitation or have access to the team

fields.summary: Stack trace when attempting to add external user with spaces in the username to Google Apps-enabled OnDemand instance

fields.description:
A recent change on https://id.atlassian.com brought the _Sign up for an account_ button next to the _Can't log in_ button.

This can create confusion for users that access a Jira site and are prompted to login. They might think that creating an Atlassian Account automatically grants them access to that specific Jira (the one they initially attempted to visit). The admins of a Jira/Confluence site can have the same confusion, thinking that their site is open for everyone to create an account. 

Please consider removing that button or placing it somewhere else.
fields.summary: remove the signup button from the login page on id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As described at [Troubleshooting Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/troubleshoot-atlassian-account-938856825.html#TroubleshootAtlassianaccount-TroubleshootingAtlassianaccount], some users see the login button spinning and are unable to login to Atlassian Cloud where their browser blocks cross-site cookies.

The problem is there's no way to nudge these users to change the setting.

 !jac-login-spinning.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Detect if a third-party cookie is blocked on the client side (refer to [stackoverflow.com|https://stackoverflow.com/a/34991552/879951]), and show the friendly notice to enable third-party cookies.
fields.summary: Show user-friendly message not to block 3rd-party cookies

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a jira administrator I completely removed the *Stride* or *Jira Service Desk* product but I still cannot remove the default group *Stride-users* or *jira-servicedesk-users*. The error states: 
"You can't delete this group because it is a default access group"

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove Stride
# go to product access to verify the default group configuration
# Confirm that the product Stride is not showing up in there. 
# go to groups and try to remove *Stride-users* group. 

h3. Expected Results
Group gets removed. 

h3. Actual Results
"You can't delete this group because it is a default access group"
 
h3. Notes
The issue occurs for default group of any product that has been unsubscribed, such as Jira Ops, Jira Core, etc.

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Allow to delete application default group after removing the product

fields.description:
When trying to mention a user ( with @mention or [~mention] ) or finding them in the listed users of a user picker field (eg. Assignee) the user does not show up as an option. The specific user can't be mentioned by anyone on pages or comments. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page or comment
 # Type "@user"

h3. Expected Results
 * You can select the desired user to mention
 * You can find the user in the *Assignee* field in Jira

h3. Actual Results
 * The user doesn't show up as an option and cannot be mentioned

h3. Notes
 * This will also make it impossible to add the user individually on space permissions and page restrictions.
 * This is a very specific bug, but the symptoms are common. If you can [~ mention, or if you are unable to mention more than a few specific users, this bug is not what you are dealing with. 
 * The specific user will not be able to mention any other user as well.
 * In Jira, this seems to only happen in the new issue view.

h3. Workarounds
 * First one:
 ** Contact our support team through [https://support.atlassian.com/] and include the following information:
  The user(s) being affected
  A link to this report (or simply mention CONFCLOUD-67259)
 * Second one: 
 ** Go to the site's administration > Users > Select the user > change the User Role to *Trusted*, refresh the page and then, change it back to the previous role (Site administrator/Basic).
* Third one (strictly for Jira)
** Temporarily switch to the old issue view
fields.summary: Cannot mention specific user in pages or comments at all

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who requested access to Jira will be given access to all applications under Jira suites i.e. Jira Core, Jira Software and Jira Service Desk.

This could cause unwanted access granted to users who only requested access to specific Jira applications.

h3. Suggested solution

Allow site admin to only grant access to specific Jira applications or users can only request for the application they need.
fields.summary: Granting access to users via Access Request feature should only grant to specific Jira application

fields.description:
h3.Summary

User deactivation currently do not work from the user list in the new user management UI. Although the notice shows that the deactivation is successful , once you refresh the page, the user is activated again.

!Untitled1.png|thumbnail!

It does however work if the deactivation is done from within the user profile page.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround

Perform deactivation in the user profile page instead of from the user list page.
fields.summary: User deactivation not working from user list view in new user management UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The user search box, in the user management, fails to render the text correctly on it, in case you resize the Google Chrome window or Safari.

Steps to reproduce

# Open the user management;
# Click on _Users_;
# Type text to search;
# Resize the Google chrome window.
#  !user_search_box1.png|thumbnail! 
#  !user_search_box2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The text should stay visible even if the window is resized

h3. Actual Results

The left part of the text move to the left and its hidden by the box

h3. Notes 

It affects Google Chrome and Safari browsers. It didn't happen in Firefox. 

h3.Workaround

Use a browser not affected by the bug (Firefox) OR decrease the zoom of the browser (varies depending on monitor size)
fields.summary: Search box of the user fails to render correctly the text in Chrome and Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*View Jira project roles* & *Edit User Properties* functionality is missing in the new user management page

Reference Documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/add-data-to-users-for-advanced-functions-jira-applications-only-744721649.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/edit-user-project-roles-jira-applications-only-744721647.html

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud, new User Management interface

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the site administration area
 # Attempt to change the user properties for a certain user
# Notice that the functionality is missing

h3. Expected Results
The site-admin should have the option to change the user properties, just like in the old user management interface: Click on the user's name, then expand the drop-down next to _Reset Password_ and then click on *Edit Jira Properties*

 !Edit_User_Properties_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
This functionality is missing in the new UI

h3. Workarounds

To access the User properties you can use this link:
* https://<host>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/EditUserProperties.jspa?accountId=<id>

To access the Project roles you can use this link:
* https://<host>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa?name=<username>
fields.summary: View Jira project roles & Edit User Properties functionality is missing in the new user management page

fields.description:
h3.Summary

With the new invite screen for Atlassian Cloud, it is now possible to distinguish between trusted and basic users on invitation. 

 !basic1.PNG|thumbnail!  

Basic users are users with very limited access (aka read-only users) however after accepting invitations, it is currently possible for basic users to invite other users into the Cloud instance even though they should not be able to do this. 

!basic2.PNG|thumbnail! 

If abused, this can lead to cluttering up the user management with invited users.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Invite a new user to the Cloud instance using your own personal email.
# Accept the invitation email that is being sent and log in to the Cloud instance.
# The welcome page will allow you to invite other users to the instance.

h3.Expected Behavior

Basic users should not be able to invite users. This privilege should only be reserved to trusted users.

h3.Current Behavior

Basic users are able to invite users from the welcome screen.

h3.Workaround

No workaround for this currently.
fields.summary: Basic users should not be able to invite other users to the Cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When activating a Jira product, every single user (inactive and active) in the *User management* are added to the default access group of that product and product access.

In result of this, you suddenly have up to 5000 users with a Jira Ops license or 100 users with a Jira Software license which is counted towards your license usage.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to *Discover applications* in the Site Administration and activate any JIRA product (ie: Jira Ops) by clicking on *Free trial*. 

h3. Expected Results
Product Jira Ops added.

h3. Actual Results

Product Jira Ops added and all users in the *User management* are added to the default access group with a license (up to 5000 slots).

 !User_management_-_Application_accessmnax.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This most likely happens because since the product doesn't exist yet, you cannot manage Default application access in the *User defaults* settings.

 !User_management_-_Application_access.png|thumbnail! 

Although *Inactive* users are added to the group as well, they remain *inactive* and are not counted towards the license usage.

{panel:bgColor=#ffb4b4}
(!) If a user has product access to *Jira Ops*, they will consequently have access to *Jira Software* as well. What this means is that the user will be able to see *Jira Ops* and *Jira Software* Projects depending on the *Permission Scheme* (any logged in user).
{panel}

h3.Workaround
No workaround is known at this moment. Users must be removed manually from the group, if there are too many users to do this manually, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Activating a Jira product gives product access to all users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to create a Bitbucket account with the email address already associated with an Atlassian Account the user is asked to log in  with the Atlassian account but after being redirected to https://id.atlassian.com an error appears:
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access https://bitbucket.org > click on *Get started*
# Enter your Atlassian Account email address then you will receive the following message:
!image.png|thumbnail!
# Click *Sign up with your Atlassian Account* and you will be redirected to https://id.atlassian.com triggering the bug:
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
- You should be able to login with your Atlassian Account normally.

h3. Actual Results
- It is said that you don't have access to Bitbucket (which you are trying to create an account at) and ask you to try using a different account. 

h3. Workaround
# Click at *Log in to another account*:
!image.png|thumbnail!
# Enter you email+password and you will be asked to choose a Bitbucket username to complete the account creation process: 
!image3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating a Bitbucket account does not work when a user does not have access to a repository due to "Account switch" feature

fields.description:
The introduction of profile and visibility settings only allows control on restricted fields of managed account profiles such as full name.

All other fields below are not restricted to organisation admin only update , nor is there allowance to make these fields editable by only organisation admin. 

This feature request scope is to allow restriction to the update of sensitive fields like Job Title, to be only allowed to Site Admins and Organisation Admins. 

A sample scenario : 
 Organisations may want to prohibit end-users from setting their own information like job
 title. Ideally, this will come from trusted sources internally in their organisation instead.
fields.summary: Introduce more control over managed user profile and visibility settings

fields.description:
A security feature we should offer customers is the ability to enforce re-authentication on sensitive actions. Ideally this would be embedded in product features such as Admin Key, SAML changes in Access, etc.

Context on re-auth:

> Reauthenticate For Important Actions

Authentication isn’t only important when logging in. We can also use it to provide additional protection when users perform sensitive actions such as changing their password or transferring money. This can help limit the exposure in the event a user’s account is compromised. For example, some online merchants require you to re-enter details from your credit card when making a purchase to a newly-added shipping address. It is also helpful to require users to re-enter their passwords when updating their personal information.

From https://martinfowler.com/articles/web-security-basics.html

or see: https://opsec.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/re-authentication-on-sensitive-actions.html

Relevant conversation from Admin Key:
https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMC/pages/376812061/Admin+Key+Security+Architectural+Review?focusedCommentId=376523468#comment-376523468
fields.summary: Provide a "reauthenticate on sensitive action" workflow

fields.description:
h3. Case description

Site-admins not necessarily need to consume a license from each product and, in fact, if the instance Product access settings are tweaked you can have site-admins not consuming licenses to all products. This is a very popular used approach for SD licenses.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure the site-admins group doesn't have access to one or more products.
# Get a user with basic access and turn him into a trusted user.
# Add him to the *site-admins* group manually(don't use the *Roles* select list).
# Check the license counts and the user should be consuming a license for all products.

h3. Suggested behavior

The user should be added to the site-admins group and removed from the hidden trusted-users group as it happens when granting the site-admins access through the *Roles* select list.

h3. Current behavior

The user becomes a site-admin but remains a member of the trusted-users group and per the trusted users logic he will automatically consume a license for all products no matter what.


h3. Workaround

Through the *Roles* select list, make the user trusted again and then a site-admin.
If there's only one site-admin at the instance please contact Atlassian Support for help.
fields.summary: Site-admins on the trusted user groups consume a license for all products

fields.description:
When creating an account it's required to provide a password, if you apply a password with less than 8 characters the UI displays "The password is too short." without informing the minimum requirements to create the password. This feature request is to change the message when creating the password to display the minimum requirements. 

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-09 at 10.49.58.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide minimum requirements to create a password in Atlassian Cloud at the UI

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare two users A, B who are in the same org using the same domain
# user A: access https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility and set the profile picture to organization visible
# user B: log in to Jira Cloud and look for user A's activity

h3. Expected Results
user B can see user A's profile picture

h3. Actual Results
user B can't see user A's profile picture
 
h3. Notes
This happens only in certain accounts in the same org.

h3. Workaround
If possible, set the visibility of the profile icon to "anyone"

There are cases where you need to reproduce the same scenario, but if you have to remove the user from the site-admins group to impersonate him, the scenario won't be the same.

# Go to User management
# Export users

h3. Expected Results

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When an Atlassian account is signed up a verification is required using the verification link that is being sent to the account's email. If the email address is unable to receive messages/emails the verification is not possible, hence the user can't login into this account. This is true for both managed and unmanaged accounts.

h3. Why this is important
When a domain is claimed, the organization admin owns all Atlassian accounts under the claimed domain(s). Hence, an organization admin should be able to verify the Atlassian account instead of requesting each user to perform validation individually.

On the other hand, account verification through email forces the organization to actually establish an email account for every single user, with all the overhead of administration and license costs, and teaching all users how to access the mailbox and how to click on the verification link.

h3. Suggested resolution
Please implement the ability for organization admins to be able to verify an account without a verification link being sent to the account's email.
fields.summary: Ability to verify Atlassian accounts for managed accounts by organization admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user is active in the cloud site but does not have any application access it does comes in the CSV export file (admin page > Users > Export users). This happens even when *USERS* > *All users on the site* is selected and *USER STATUS* is set to *all users*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove the application access of a user by accessing its profile in your cloud site (i.e. <yoursite>.atlassian.net/admin/users > select a user) and uncheck the access to Jira/Confluence. 
 # Create a [Export file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-users-from-a-site-833925313.html]
# Check the file and the user with no application access won't be listed there. 

h3. Expected Results
When the export feature has an *All users on the site* option it should display all user under that site list not only those with application access. 

h3. Actual Results
Only users with application access are exported in the file. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting users on the site administration page does not list users without application access

fields.description:
Users are able to put just about anything from special characters to single names or even mistakenly think the field is meant for the password, while the second field is the confirmation of it, like for other services.

h1. Suggestion
Add a field validator that won't allow special characters into the field such as @!#$* and require that at least two words are put into the field.

h1. Exceptions
Add exceptions to singers like Madonna, Ke$ha, Bono, Eminem, etc.
fields.summary: Full name validations on Atlassian account creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to access a wiki page without login session, users will be redirected to our Atlassian login page. After successful login, users are redirected to an invalid URL. This is because the wiki page is encoded twice.  

For example,  using my test page as an example, below is the original URL.

https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IN/pages/414875649/Test+Confluence+Space

The application encodes it once to :

{noformat}
https%3A%2F%2Fzaansmeisje.atlassian.net%2Fwiki%2Fspaces%2FIN%2Fpages%2F414875649%2FTest%2BConfluence%2BSpace
{noformat}

However after a successful login, the application encode the '%' character  into '%25'  :

{noformat}
%252Fwiki%252Fspaces%252FIN%252Fpages%252F414875649%252FTest%2520Confluence%2520Space%26application%3Dconfluence
{noformat}

This leads to a malformed request error.

 !image-2019-07-31-20-29-53-644.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a name that has spacing/white space (e.g Atlassian Test).
 # Copy the URL of the newly created space and paste it in incognito window.
 # You will be prompted to login, go through the login process and you will be redirected to a malformed request error page.

h3. Expected Results
Proper redirection with the wiki page loading correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Redirection URL is encoded another time leading to malformed URL.

h3. Workaround
Load the actual page URL on the browser URL bar again.
fields.summary: Double encoding on Confluence wiki page URLs after login redirection

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the recent (May 2019) [changes to privacy settings of Atlassian Accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/05/upcoming-changes-to-atlassian-account-profiles] the users' details can be set to:
*Anyone* - _This information is visible to anyone who can view your content, which may include people outside of your organization. For example, if your admin has set up Jira to allow anonymous access, then anyone who browses to your Jira issues can view this personal information. This information is also accessible by apps installed in Atlassian cloud products._

*The name of your organization* - _This information is only visible to other users managed by your organization. Typically, this is anyone who shares your organization’s email domain, such as acme.com._

*Only you* - _This information is only visible to you. (This option is offered on a few fields.)_

Source: [Update your profile and visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-968656104.html].

The information displayed on the user's profile at https://id.atlassian.com make us believe that the privacy setting is applied based on the Organization the user is part of not the domain specifically as we can see in the screenshot below:
!image.png|thumbnail!

However Org admins that are not tied to the verified domains of the Org can't see the users' details when set to *The name of your organization*.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it possible for Org admins to see the user's details regardless the domain related to their account.
fields.summary: Make it possible for Org admins to see the user's details regardless the domain related to their account

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customers who use Confluence to collaborate may find it difficult to identify other users within the product, not everyone belongs to the same organization and asking everyone on the site to set their profile visibility to public and make it happen is impossible. Not to mention that the profile would be visible to everyone and not just the site.

h3. Suggestions
* Have a site based privacy control for Atlassian accounts where the end users can trust sites to show their private information.
* Give control to site administrators to ask for end user consent to private details/trust the site.

h3. Workarounds
* Create a page on the site that end users can store needed personal information for the site.
* Create an on-boarding process for end users to create a personal space and add their needed personal information into their Home.
fields.summary: Have a site based privacy control for Atlassian accounts and organizations

fields.description:
*Summary*
- After deleting a user from a Jira/Confluence instance, this user is still showing on the People Directory. Additionally, if we try to click on the user to see its profile we get an error message saying: "Something went wrong. We keep track of these errors, but feel free to contact us if refreshing doesn’t fix things."

*Environment*
- Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Interact with a user to make it appear in the People Directory page
# Remove the user from the instance
# Go to the People Direct page again

*Expected Results*
- The user won't show in the People Directory page after being removed from the instance

*Actual Results*
- The user is still appearing in the People Directory page and if you click on it you will be redirected to a page showing the message: "Something went wrong. We keep track of these errors, but feel free to contact us if refreshing doesn’t fix things."

*Workaround*
- Interact with other users to change the ones that appear in the People Directory page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since our recent [profile privacy changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/05/upcoming-changes-to-atlassian-account-profiles], managed users lost the ability to change their full name on start.atlassian.com while not tied to external directories through SAML, SCIM or G Suite.

Before the change, users were able to do that, also confirmed by our public documentation about [Atlassian account for users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html]:
{quote}If your account is managed by your company, only your admin can:
 * Update the email address for the account
 * Deactivate or delete the account{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an Atlassian organization with your domain verified.
 # Have a managed user under the same domain.
 # The user logs in to start.atlassian.com and clicks to *Manage Profile*, through the main screen or profile picture on the low-left corner.
 # The user tries to change the full name.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to edit the field inline and change the full name.
h3. Actual Results

The user is prompted that only the organization administrator can do that:
 !image-2019-07-24-18-54-56-502.png!
h3. Notes

The end users can no longer change their own full names and they do not have visibility of who to contact for this change.
h3. Workaround

Reach out to [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com] for the contact information of their organization administrators.
fields.summary: Managed users not tied to an external directory are not being able to change their full name

fields.description:
{panel:title=Disclaimer|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
After further investigating the privacy settings we notice that the tests we did to validate the visibility between managed accounts under the same Org were not accurate thus this is not a valid _*feature request*_. Below are the steps we followed to test this behavior and the outcome:
# Verify two domains (i.e. a & b) in the same [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html]
# Change the privacy settings of one Atlassian Account related to one of that verified domains to *The name of your organization*
# Check the account at the *Managed accounts* page to see if we were still able to see the account avatar and full name. 

- The problem here is that we were logged in with an *Org admin* account that was not part of those verified domain (i.e. c) thus the privacy account didn't work to that account because it was not "part of the Org" (not related to one of the Org verified domains). Testing the same behavior logged in with an account that is tied to the verified domains works as expected. 

With that, we believe it would be best to close out this feature request and opened a new one:
- [Make it possible for Org admins to see the user's details even when they are not using emails related to the verified domains|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-7047]

Apologies for any inconvenience this caused to your or to your company
{panel}

{panel:title=Original request| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc | titleBGColor=#F7D6C1}
h3. Problem Definition
With the recent (May 2019) [changes to privacy settings of Atlassian Accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/05/upcoming-changes-to-atlassian-account-profiles] the users' details can be set to:
*Anyone* - _This information is visible to anyone who can view your content, which may include people outside of your organization. For example, if your admin has set up Jira to allow anonymous access, then anyone who browses to your Jira issues can view this personal information. This information is also accessible by apps installed in Atlassian cloud products._

*The name of your organization* - _This information is only visible to other users managed by your organization. Typically, this is anyone who shares your organization’s email domain, such as acme.com._

*Only you* - _This information is only visible to you. (This option is offered on a few fields.)_

Source: [Update your profile and visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-968656104.html].

Differently from that doc, the information displayed on the user's profile at https://id.atlassian.com make us believe that the privacy setting is applied based on the Organization the user is part of not the domain specifically as we can see in the screenshot below:
!profile.png|thumbnail!

This information causes some confusion and forces companies to make their privacy setting to *Anyone* so users under the same Org but with different domains can see each other's details which goes against that feature in the first place. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make the privacy setting based on the Org Id, not the verified domain since one Org can hold more than one domain.
{panel}
fields.summary: Make it possible for users under the same Org to see each other's details when it set to "The name of your organization"

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

 User is unable to delete this group because it's the default group.
 Also, Confluence won't show up in the "Product access" menu anymore so there are no way to remove the "default group" setting as well

h3. Workaround
N/A

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Document: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/api-changes-for-user-privacy-announcement/ doesn't reflect the change in behaviour as described in this ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user via REST API
# Fetch user data immediately afterwards

h3. Expected Results
* The user data(name, email address, etc.) is immediately available

h3. Actual Results
* The account now needs to be synced first in order for the data to be retrieved
* The result is that the data for newly created users are missing
{noformat}
"reporter": {
"self": "https://<host>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=<accountId>",
"accountId": "<accountId>",
"emailAddress": "\"?\"",
"avatarUrls":

{ "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default", "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default", "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default", "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default" }
,
"displayName": "\"Failed to Retrieve User <accoundId>",
"active": true,
"timeZone": "Asia/Calcutta",
"accountType": "customer"
},
{noformat}
* One may need to wait up to 5 minutes for the cache to clear and then run the call to fetch the profile data again


h3. Notes
* This change affects how customers need to implement their scripts as many now have to set a delay/sleep the script to allow time for 30seconds - 1 minute should be sufficient.  Data is cached for 5 minutes, so if the data is incomplete - users may need to wait 5 minutes before running the call again
* Documentation should be updated to reflect this change in behaviour as before - the profile data could be fetched instantaneously

h3. Workaround
* Wait 30 seconds - 1 minute and then run a call to fetch the user profile data
fields.summary: "Major changes to Jira Cloud REST APIs are coming to improve user privacy" document doesn't mention anything regarding performance/caching

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Billing section does not change the context as expected when there are more than 2 sites linked to an Org. When navigating between the sites there is a delay on the billing information update between one cloud site to another.

!siteA.png|thumbnail!
# Navigate to site B *Billing estimate* page 
!siteBbeforerefresh.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a Cloud Administrator has removed their Site-Admins group from the Jira Product Access > Administration Access and the Site-Admin is not a member of another "Jira Administration" group, those Site-Admin Users are not able to view the Jira Service Desk Customers within User Management

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In Site User Management
# Add a User to the *Site-Admins* group and remove them from all other 'admin' Groups
# Add/Verify that the *Site-Admins* group has Jira Service Desk Product Access
# Remove the *Site-Admins* group from Jira Administration access
# Navigate to Jira Service Desk to view Portal-only Customer accounts

h3. Expected Results
Site-Admin is able to view the Portal-only Customers in their site to manage Customer accounts

h3. Actual Results
UI shows "Something went Wrong"
 !image-2019-07-08-13-28-11-556.png|thumbnail! 

Browser console shows the following error:
{noformat}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 ()
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Some customers have removed the Site-Admins group from having Jira Administration Access to limit their access to Jira Administration

As the Site-Admin group is the highest level permission a User can have within the Cloud Environment, there is no mechanism which will prevent them from adding themselves to a Group that grants Jira Administration Access nor adding the Site-Admins group back to Jira Administration Access

Feature Request to have a Separate Role/Group/Permission to manage Users/Groups without having Product Admin access - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69021

h3. Workaround
Add the Site-Admins group to the Product Access > Administration Access for Jira
or
Add the Site-Admin User to another group that grants Jira Administration Access
fields.summary: Non-Jira Administrator Site-Admins are Unable to View Service Desk Customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- When using SAML, users can't log in with a new Atlassian account if the old domain is not verified anymore. The SAML ID doesn't change from the old account to the new one

h3. Environment
- Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Verify a domain and set-up a SAML SSO integration with Atlassian
# Log in to create a SAML ID with the Atlassian account
# Verify a new domain and remove the old one
# Create a new Atlassian account with the new domain
# Change the user's email in the IdP
# Log in with the new email

h3. Expected Results
- The user can log in without problems. The "_login.forbidden.handle-linked-saml-users.update-linked-primary-user-email-failed-400.content_" is not a problem anymore

h3. Actual Results
- The user can't log in. A message error appears saying:  "_Oops, there was an error logging you in. login.forbidden.verify-saml-domains.invalid-email-domain-for-primary-user.content_". Error attached.

h3. Workaround
- Re-verify the old domain and ask the users to log in with their new account.
fields.summary: When using SAML, users can't log in with a new Atlassian account if the old domain is not verified anymore.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding more than on site to an organization, the primary site will block the _site-admins_ group management via User Management section, whereas for the next sites tied to the Org it will still be possible to manage _site-admins_ users from User Management section. For example, you can still add users to _site-admins_ group without making them Org admins.

h3. Environment
* Have an organization;
* Have two sites linked into it;
* Access the second site linked and the site-admins group and you will be able to add users as site-admin on it yet.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Organization
 # Link two sites into it
 # Access a group from the second site linked
 # You'll be able to add users as site-admins there, without making them org admins.

Screenshot from the primary site:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-02 at 17.32.32.png|thumbnail! 
Screenshot from the second site:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-02 at 17.32.50.png|thumbnail! 

* _the problem is not reproducible anymore after linking a third site in the org_

h3. Expected Results
Manage users from all linked sites from your Organization and site-admins will be merged with org admins.

h3. Actual Results
You will be able to manage users from https://admin.atlassian.com only for the first site linked.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available
fields.summary: When linking two sites with an Organization, you still can add site-admins on the second site

fields.description:

Using SAML with Cloud may offer some solution from a Identity Provider perspective

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Granting/Denying Access to Users in a Cloud Site, a Site-Admin may want to review the User's profile before making a decision, however, the Link to the User's profile does not load and redirects the Admin to the Admin Hub Home page (admin.atlassian.com)

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
As a Site-Admin
 # Navigate to Admin.atlassian.com and enter your Cloud Site
 # Click on Access Request > Ellipsis Icon > Show Profile

h3. Expected Results
Page loads displaying the User's Profile

h3. Actual Results
Site-Admin is redirected to the Admin Hub Home Screen

Browser Console Logging shows a 404 Error with navigation attempted to
{code}https://admin.atlassian.com/admin/users/view?email=<EMAIL ADDRESS>{code}

h3. Notes
The URL for a User's profile follows:
{code}https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<SITE ID>users/<ACCOUNT ID>{code}

h3. Workaround

If the User already has access to your Cloud Site, they can be found by searching for them in the User section of User Administration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users are invited to Confluence by a different user they have added to a list at the site administration page > *Access requests* as we can see in the image below:
!access.png|thumbnail!

If a site-admin added the user to *Confluence* manually in the user's profile (by checking *Confluence* checkbox) the request is still there which might be expected since those are different methods to achieve the same goal. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature that removes the user from the *Access requests* once he/she is granted *Confluence* access.
fields.summary: Improvement to the Access Requests page

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user has an existing session on the external SSO but none on Atlassian Cloud, the user will still need to go through the login form in https://id.atlassian.com and manually enter the email address. The authentication will be skipped on the SSO side, due to existing session cookie and id.atlassian.com will generate the new cloud session token. 

Suggestion :

Allow the login flow to be able to use the existing external SSO session token without manually entering the email address in https://id.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Better option to pick up an existing SSO session in Atlassian cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Email change REST API [/users/\{account_id}/manage/email|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/#api-users-account-id-manage-email-put] is not keeping the Atlassian account verified.
h3. Environment
 * Production

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call the REST API to change an email to the same domain.

h3. Expected Results

Email updated and the Atlassian account will remain with the new email verified.
h3. Actual Results

Email updated but the Atlassian account becomes unverified on the new email.
h3. Notes

The documentation states that the account should remain with the email verified:
{quote}
h3. Set the email address of the current user to the specified value. In order to perform this kind of change, the consumer _must_ be able to assert control of both the source and target domains as the updated email **will be considered verified**.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Email change REST API /users/{account_id}/manage/email is not keeping the Atlassian account verified

fields.description:
*Problem*
* Managed users can use the "Can't log in?" option to bypass the SAML SSO integration at any time. Additionally, the users can also bypass the 2FA. Although this is a helpful tool, this is also a  security weakness.

*Suggestion*
* Allow org admins to disable the "Can't log in?" option for the users that are not org administrators. If users that are not org admins can't access the SAML SSO configuration and fix any problem with the set up, there is no reason for these users to have the ability to bypass the SAML SSO integration or the 2FA.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to disable the "Can't log in?" option to prevent users to bypass 2FA and SAML login

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When you update email for a managed account that utilises SAML SSO to login, you will need to login to id.atlassian.com to verify changes, which requires your Atlassian account password. Users that use IdP (e.g OneLogin) password for single sign-on might enter their IdP password for email update verification.

Let's say domain *example.com* is claimed in an organization and has SAML SSO enabled. And you wish to update email for *user@example.com* (managed account) to a different email address (e.g user@another-domain.com). Here are the steps:
# As an organization admin find the managed account for *user@example.com* in [admin hub|https://admin.atlassian.com] and change the email to *user@another-domain.com*. A verification email will be sent to *user@another-domain.com*
# If you don't have Atlassian account password for *user@example.com*, use following link to reset your password.
#* https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
# Access the verification email in *user@another-domain.com* mailbox and click on verification link/button. You will be directed to https://id.atlassian.com to login
# Enter the password you set in step #2

h3. Suggested resolution
Please update [Make changes to a managed user account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/make-changes-to-a-managed-user-account-964957894.html] and include instructions for the right password that need to be used for email verification in id.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Update documentation for changing email for a managed account with SAML SSO enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When integrating G Suite with a site that already belongs to an organization, and the user trying to set it up is a site-admin but not an organization admin, the setup will be started and the user will be prompt to create an organization. Since the site already belongs to another organization, an empty organization will be created and the integration won't happen.
h3. Environment
 * Have a user that is a site-admin but not an organization admin;
 * An organization with a site linked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login with a user that is a site-admin but not an organization admin;
 # Start to set up G Suite with this user;
 # The set up will prompt the organization creation;
 # Follow the wizard to create the organization and conclude the configuration.

h3. Expected Results

Prompt an error message informing that the integration cannot move forward as this site is already linked to another organization.
h3. Actual Results

A new empty organization is created and the following errors are thrown:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 17.03.58.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

In the console the following error is displayed:
{code:java}
{"status":400,"message":"orgSiteLinkingAlreadyExists"}{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Contact the site-admins to check which organization is linked. – This information can be checked over the site name as below:
 !Image 2019-06-25 at 7.17.46 PM.png|thumbnail!
 * Once the organization is discovered, follow the steps on [how to merge existing organizations using this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html].
 * Once the organizations are merged, the site-admins will become organization admins in the existing organization and will be able to proceed with the integration.

If you don't find the linked organization, please raise a ticket with Support.
fields.summary: When integrating G Suite with a Site that already belongs to an organization another organization is incorrectly created.

When customers are added while the default Product Access is turned off would not have access to the site since the option "Has access on site" is disabled by default

 # Create a new user

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The user does not have access to site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * In cases where a domain is allowed to self signup...
 * When a new user creates their own account, they are presented with 2 screens:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-06-19 at 10.30.12.png|thumbnail!|Confirm creation of new account|
|!Screen Shot 2019-06-19 at 10.30.41.png|thumbnail!  |This page appears afterwards|

 * Clicking "Try again" will allow users through to the instance
 * This is expected behavior as the account needs to be created, synced and then login can commence
 * The "Your operation is taking longer than usual" message sets the wrong expectation as this implies that something is wrong.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Eliminate the extra click by auto-refreshing, or automatically redirect to the instance
 * Change the wording to "Welcome! Thanks for signing up - click to continue through to your instance"(or similar)
 * Increase the "timeout" period

h3. Why this is important
 * The current messaging gives the impression that something is broken/wrong

h3. Workaround
 * Continue through the process by clicking on the "Try again" button:
!Screen Shot 2019-06-19 at 10.30.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Site access: "Your operation is taking longer than usual" appears when a user goes though the self signup procress

Provide user management API for last login for a product or site

fields.description:
Organization administrators are getting blocked from deleting certain managed accounts because these accounts have active subscriptions tied to them, currently, this is demanding quite some effort from the administrator as they need to:
# Re-gain access to the Atlassian account so they can transfer the subscriptions
#* Sometimes they do not have an SSO to set that up easily
#* The mail box in most cases will no longer exist to recover the account
# As a last resort, they need to change the email to become an alias of their own accounts
# Transfer the actual subscriptions or simply deactivate them - Which depending on the product, may take up to 15 days as a Cloud site (Jira or Confluence) has to be destroyed before unblocking the account for deletion.

There are cases where the end users had to initiate several Cloud sites for testing purposes, making the process very time consuming; or still have active free subscriptions related to Bitbucket; or any open quotes for Atlassian server based products.

h1. Suggestion
Make it possible for administrators to chose to allocate all the subscriptions, quotes, etc to the administrator performing the action, or also provide the option to automatically cancel and destroy everything.
fields.summary: Provide the option to allocate all product subscriptions of a deleted managed user to the administrator the action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Only 1100 customers can/will be exported. In a case where you have more than 1100 portal only customers, you wouldn't be able to export all of them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite 1101 portal only customers
 # Go to Site-administration > JIRA Service Desk > Export Customers

h3. Expected Results
All customers are exported to CSV

h3. Actual Results
Only 1100 customers are exported to CSV

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to export all JIRA Service Desk portal only customer when there are more than 1100 customers.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Atlassian Access requires the org admins to set their last name when trying to start the trial. The user cannot tell what they should do if the display name is set in eastern-style because there's no convention to place a space between first name and last name in eastern countries.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Clarify the detailed requirement (to put a space in the middle) but not only showing the URL, so that the user can tell what they should do.
* Or, remove the requirement if possible to align with other services in Atlassian.

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email. Until then,

* Place whitespace between your first name and last name
** (x) *李振藩*
** (/) *李 振藩*
fields.summary: Clarify how to set a valid last name in the provisioning process

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the User Management > Users page doesn't show the number of users when applied any filter in the UI.

h3. Suggested Solution
Would be great to have the user count somewhere in the UI so that it'll be easy for the site admins to see how many users are there in a particular product/role etc.

h3. Workaround
Site-admins can export the users into CSV file and apply the filters to find the user count.
fields.summary: Show user count in User management > Users page
